TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IHostEnvironment implements class Microsoft.ML.IChannelProvider, class Microsoft.ML.IExceptionContext, class Microsoft.ML.IProgressChannelProvider
Public Interface IHostEnvironment Implements IChannelProvider, IProgressChannelProvider
type IHostEnvironment = interface interface IChannelProvider interface IExceptionContext interface IProgressChannelProvider

Docs.summary: The host environment interface creates hosts for components. Note that the methods of this interface should be called from the main thread for the environment. To get an environment to service another thread, call Fork and pass the return result to that thread.

Docs.summary: The catalog of loadable components () that are available in this host.

MemberSignature.Value: public int ConcurrencyFactor { get; }
.property instance int32 ConcurrencyFactor
Public ReadOnly Property ConcurrencyFactor As Integer
member this.ConcurrencyFactor : int

Docs.summary: How much concurrency the component should use. A value of 1 means single-threaded. Higher values generally mean number of threads. Less than 1 means whatever the component views as ideal.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.ML.IFileHandle CreateTempFile (string suffix = null, string prefix = null);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.ML.IFileHandle CreateTempFile(string suffix, string prefix) cil managed
Public Function CreateTempFile (Optional suffix As String = null, Optional prefix As String = null) As IFileHandle
abstract member CreateTempFile : string * string -> Microsoft.ML.IFileHandle

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The host environment is not disposable, so it is inappropriate to use this method. Please handle your own temporary files within the component yourself, including their proper disposal and deletion.")

Docs.summary:
Create a temporary "file" and return a handle to it. Generally temp files are expected to be written to exactly once, and then can be read multiple times. Note that IFileHandle derives from IDisposable. Clients may dispose the IFileHandle when it is no longer needed, but they are not required to. The host environment should track all temp file handles and ensure that they are disposed properly when the environment is "shut down".
The suffix and prefix are optional. A common use for suffix is to specify an extension, eg, ".txt". The use of suffix and prefix, including whether they have any affect, is up to the host environment.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.Composition.Hosting.CompositionContainer GetCompositionContainer ();

Public Function GetCompositionContainer () As CompositionContainer

Docs.summary: Get the MEF composition container. This can be used to instantiate user-provided 'parts' when the model is being loaded, or the components are otherwise created via dependency injection.

Docs.summary: Flag which indicate should we stop any code execution in this host.
